channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesMainNLbusinessAndMarkets, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Court Filing Reveals OpenAI’s Goals for ChatGPT. They Want You Using AI Everywhere
item.description: The leading AI maker wants its signature product to be much more than a useful chatbot. That could change our daily work and home lives forever.

item.title: New York City’s Pride organizers are racing to fill a fundraising gap as PepsiCo, Nissan, and others retreat from DEI policies
item.description: Many U.S. corporations this year stopped supporting Pride events that celebrate LGBTQ+ culture and rights.

item.title: What you need to know about Moderna’s new COVID vaccine, just approved by the FDA
item.description: The shot had previously been approved for everyone 12 and older. Now, there are limits.

item.title: Why This IBM Exec Says AI Adoption Should Be Led by HR
item.description: After undergoing a major culture change, the tech company uses AI to measure whether employees are ‘okay with failure.’

item.title: DOGE Takes Aim at Outside IT After Slashing Consulting Contracts
item.description: The campaign to cut government spending is now demanding that outside contractors justify their costs.

item.title: Treasury head Scott Bessent says Jamie Dimon should relax about the bond markets: ‘For his entire career he’s made predictions…none of them have come true’

item.title: Steel Prices Jump Ahead of Trump’s New Tariffs
item.description: Trump announced on Friday the new steel and aluminum levies, which take effect on June 4, intensifying a global trade war.

item.title: Do At-Home Health Tests Work?
item.description: At-home health tests are here. But they aren’t always the best option

item.description: Eric Spofford, the founder and former CEO of Granite Recovery Centers, allegedly paid his friend $20,000 to vandalize their homes.
